Dòminum~; laŭdáte nomen Dòmini. ^ Prais: et usqŭe in sáĕculum. ^ Blessed be the name of the Lord

1 ^ Laŭdáte: 3 ^ A solis ortu usqŭe ad occásum laŭdábile nomen Dòmini. ^ From the rising of the sun to its setting praiseworthy is name of the Lord.

púeri: et super caĕlos glória ejus. ^ The Lord is high above all nations
Dòminum~; laŭdáte nomen Dòmini. ^ Prais: and his glory above the heavens.
^ Who is as the Lord our God

1 ^ Laŭdáte: 6 ^ et humìlia rèspicit in caĕlo et in terra~? ^ and looketh down on the low things in heaven and in earth~?

ye children~; praise ye the name of the: and lifting up the poor out of the dunghill

púeri: cum princìpibus pòpuli sui. ^ that he may place him with princes
Dòminum~; laŭdáte nomen Dòmini. ^ Prais: with the princes of his people.

púeri: matrem filiórum laĕtántem. ^ Who maketh a barren woman to dwell in a house
